clinical_study.brief_title: Methotrexate Polyglutamate Measurements in Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Methotrexate Polyglutamate Measurements in Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease

brief_summary.textblock: There are currently no serum levels to help guide appropriate methotrexate therapy. Data from this study will assess the correlation between dosing and whole blood methotrexate(MTX) polyglutamate measurements in children and adolescents with IBD.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a cross-sectional study design. Subjects will be requested to provide one blood sample to be collected during the conduct of their routine clinical care. Data related to the diagnosis and interval assessment of enrolled subjects will also be collected.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will collected within 16 weeks of consent.

secondary_outcome.measure: The correlation between Methotrexate Polyglutamate Levels and Lab Parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will collected within 16 weeks of consent.
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the relationship between Methotrexate Polyglutamage levels and ESR,CRP, Hemoglobin, and Albumin

secondary_outcome.measure: The correlation between Methotrexate Polyglutamate Levels and Clinical History
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will collected within 16 weeks of consent.
secondary_outcome.description: Do Methotrexate Polyglutamate Levels Predict Clinical Outcome as Measured by Disease Activity Indices, including PUCAI for ulcerative colitis and PCDAI for patients with Crohn Disease

study_pop.textblock: Patients with IBD being treated with methotrexate (oral or subcutaneous)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- IBD
- Methotrexate Therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide relevant samples
